intro: Limborchia, commonly known as the yellow-eyed grass, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, preferring moist soil conditions. Limborchia species are often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. Its botanical features make it an important component of aquatic and semi-aquatic ecosystems.
